projects.name: AI-Powered Speech Disorder Detection System
projects.tagline: Early Detection System for Pediatric Speech Disorders
projects.description: Built an ML-driven speech analysis system for early detection of pediatric speech disorders, achieving 85% accuracy in identifying cases requiring SLP intervention.
projects.problem: Early detection of speech disorders in children is critical for timely intervention, but traditional methods rely heavily on manual screening and expert availability.
projects.solution: Developed an AI-powered system using advanced machine learning to analyze speech patterns, perform vocal-pattern analysis and demographic inference (age, gender, accent), with strong emphasis on reproducibility and robust validation pipelines.
projects.impact: Implemented a scalable, real-time inference pipeline in Python to process audio streams, flag at-risk cases, and generate structured outputs for downstream clinical and analytics use. System determines whether a child requires Speech-Language Pathologist (SLP) attention with high accuracy.
projects.architecture: Audio input → Preprocessing pipeline → Speech model analysis (vocal patterns, demographics) → Real-time inference engine → Risk assessment → Structured output for clinical use
projects.lessons: Developed robust validation pipelines ensuring model reproducibility and reliability for clinical applications. Learned to balance accuracy with real-time performance requirements.

projects.name: WebAutoDash - AI Web Automation
projects.tagline: Advanced AI Tool for Web Automation and Data Extraction
projects.description: Advanced AI tool for web automation and data extraction using Playwright, LangChain, and RAG technology. Automates complex web workflows with intelligent decision-making capabilities.
projects.problem: Manual web scraping and automation tasks are time-consuming and brittle, requiring constant maintenance when websites change their structure.
projects.solution: Built an intelligent web automation system leveraging AI agents with RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation) technology to understand and adapt to web page structures dynamically, making automation more robust and maintainable.
projects.impact: Enabled automated data extraction from complex web applications with minimal configuration. AI agents can understand context and adapt to changes in website structure, reducing maintenance overhead significantly.
projects.architecture: Web target → Playwright browser automation → LangChain orchestration → RAG-enhanced understanding → AI agent decision making → Data extraction & workflow execution
projects.lessons: Learned to combine traditional browser automation with modern AI techniques to create more resilient and intelligent automation systems. RAG technology enables better context understanding for complex web interactions.

projects.name: KinesisFleet Streaming Analytics
projects.description: Built a real-time dashboard to track up to 10,000 vehicles simultaneously with low-latency telemetry updates using AWS Kinesis, Apache Druid, Redis, and S3/Glacier archival.
projects.problem: Fleet management systems needed real-time insights into vehicle performance, location, and diagnostics to enable proactive maintenance and operational efficiency.
projects.solution: Architected a high-throughput streaming data pipeline using AWS Kinesis for ingestion, Druid for fast analytical queries, Redis for caching, and automated S3/Glacier archival for historical data.
projects.impact: Implemented cron-based sync between Redis and PostgreSQL, improving data consistency and query speed. Used Kinesis + Druid for high-throughput ingestion and fast analytical queries.
projects.architecture: Vehicle sensors → Kinesis Data Streams → Druid ingestion → Redis cache layer → PostgreSQL sync (cron) → S3/Glacier archival → React dashboard
projects.lessons: Learned to balance real-time performance with cost-effective long-term storage; implemented efficient caching strategies for frequently accessed metrics.

projects.name: ProctorAI
projects.tagline: Scalable Online Proctoring Platform for 1,000+ Students
projects.description: Developed a scalable proctoring platform performing face/eye tracking, head movement detection, mobile device detection, and tab/voice monitoring for 1,000+ students with real-time alerts.
projects.problem: Online examinations lacked effective monitoring tools to ensure academic integrity at scale, requiring expensive human proctoring.
projects.solution: Built a comprehensive AI-powered proctoring system using deep learning for face tracking, eye movement analysis, head pose estimation, mobile device detection, and audio monitoring.
projects.impact: Built Flask APIs and React frontend for real-time alerts and exam monitoring with optimized inference pipelines. Published research paper 'Proctoring System using DL Techniques' at AIRHS 22 conference.
projects.architecture: WebRTC video stream → Face detection & tracking → Multi-model analysis (gaze, pose, phone detection) → Redis event queue → Alert aggregation → Admin dashboard
projects.lessons: Optimized deep learning inference pipelines for real-time performance; implemented robust alert systems to minimize false positives while maintaining high security.

projects.name: Real-time Provider Directory Platform
projects.description: Engineered backend microservices in Java and Python to modernize UnitedHealth Group's real-time provider directory platform, improving response times and data accessibility for millions of daily users.
projects.problem: Legacy monolithic architecture couldn't scale to handle increasing user traffic and regulatory compliance requirements for healthcare provider data.
projects.solution: Architected event-driven microservices using Kafka streaming, AWS cloud services, and Kubernetes orchestration with comprehensive ELK Stack monitoring.
projects.impact: Built centralized monitoring using ELK Stack, reducing debugging time by 70%. Designed scalable Kafka/Kubernetes streaming workflows, cutting data update latency by 30% and improving throughput by 25%.
projects.architecture: Provider data sources → Kafka topics → Spring Boot microservices → PostgreSQL/MongoDB → ELK monitoring → Real-time API layer → Frontend applications
projects.lessons: Mastered HIPAA-compliant architecture patterns; implemented factory, repository, and event-driven design patterns that improved service scalability by 35%.

projects.name: Vendor Risk Assessment Platform
projects.tagline: Full-Stack Tool Reducing Manual Auditing by 70%
projects.description: Built a full-stack internal risk assessment tool at KPMG using Python, Flask, React, and MongoDB to automate vendor-compliance workflows.
projects.problem: Manual vendor risk assessments were time-consuming and error-prone, creating bottlenecks in the compliance review process.
projects.solution: Developed an automated assessment platform with secure REST APIs, optimized MongoDB operations, and an intuitive React interface for compliance teams.
projects.impact: Integrated secure REST APIs with frontend components and optimized MongoDB data operations for scalability. Reduced manual auditing time by 70%, improving assessment throughput by 45% per quarter.
projects.architecture: React frontend → Flask REST API → MongoDB storage → JWT authentication → Automated compliance scoring → PDF report generation
projects.lessons: Learned to design secure authentication flows and optimize NoSQL queries for document-heavy workloads.
